<name>Published for the Early English Text Society by Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Press</name>
<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

<description type="note">Copyright (c) 1922, Early English Text Society. This text may not be reproduced, except for fair dealing purposes, without the express permission of Chadwyck-Healey and the copyright holder.</description>
<description type="note">Title: The council of the Jews.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of the text unclear in the original and supplied by the current editor.</description>

Here xal annas shewyn hym-self in his stage be-seyn after a busshop of þe hoold lawe in a skarlet gowne and ouer þat a blew tabbard furryd with whyte and a mytere on his hed after þe hoold lawe ij doctorys stondyng by hym in furryd hodys and on be-forn hem with his staff of A-stat and eche of hem on here hedys a furryd cappe with a gret knop in þe crowne and on stondyng be-forn as a sarazyn þe wich xal be his masangere Annas þus seyng Annas As a prelat am I properyd, to provyde pes And of jewys jewge þe lawe to fortefye I Annas be my powere xal comawnde dowteles Þe lawys of moyses no man xal denye Hoo excede my comawndement Anon ?e certefye Yf Any eretyk here reyn to me ?e compleyn For in me lyth þe powere all trewthis to trye And pryncypaly oure lawys þo must I susteyn. ?ef I may aspey þe contrary no wheyle xal þei reyn But a-non to me be browth and stonde present Be-fore here jewge wich xal not feyn But aftere here trespace to gef hem jugement Now serys for A prose heryth myn intent There is on jhesus of nazareth þat oure lawys doth excede Yf he procede thus we xal us all repent For oure lawys he dystroyt dayly with his dede. There fore be ?our cowncel we must take hede What is be to provyde or do in þis case Ffor yf we let hym þus go and ferdere prosede Ageyn sesare and oure lawe we do trespace. primus doctor Sere þis is myn Avyse þat ?e xal do Send to cayphas for cowncel knowe his intent For yf jhesu proce and þus forth go Oure lawys xal be dystroyd thes se we present. ijus doctor Sere remembre þe gret charge þat on ?ow is leyd Þe lawe to ke which may not ffayle Yf any defawth prevyd of ?ow be seyd Þe jewys with trewth wyl ?ow a-sayl Tak hed whath cownsayl may best provayl After rewfyn and leyon I rede þat ?e sende They arn temperal jewgys, þat knowyth þe parayl With ?oure cosyn cayphas þis matere to Amende. Annas Now surely þis cowncel revyfe myn herte ?oure cowncel is best as I can se Arfexe in hast loke þat þou styrte And pray cayphas my cosyn come speke with me. To rewfyn and leon þu go Also And pray hem þei speke with me in hast For A pryncipal matere þat haue to do Wich must be knowe or þis day be past. Arfexe My souereyn at ?our intent I xal gon In al þe hast þat I kan hy On to Cayphas rewfyn and lyon And charge ?oure intent þat þei xal ply. here goth þe masangere forth and in þe mene tyme cayphas shewyth him-self in his skafhald Arayd lych to Annas savyng his tabbard xal be red furryd with white ij doctorys with hym arayd with pellys aftyr þe old gyse and furryd cappys on here hedys Cayphas þus seyng. Cayphas As A primat most preudent I present here sensyble buschopys of þe lawe with al þe cyrcumstawns I Cayphas am jewge with powerys possyble To distroye all errouris þat in oure lawys make varyawns All thyngys I convey be reson and temperawnce And all materis possyble to me ben palpable Of þe lawe of moyses I haue A chef governawns To seuere ryth and wrong in me is termynable. but þer is on Cryst þat oure lawys is varyable he perverte þe pepyl with his prechyng ill We must seke A mene on to hym reprevable ffor yf he procede oure lawys he wyl spyll. We must take good cowncel in þis case Of þe wysest of þe lawe þat kan þe trewthe telle of þe jewgys of pharasy and of my cosyn Annas for yf he procede be prossesse oure lawys he wyl felle. primus doct[or] Myn lord plesyt ?ow to pardon me for to say þe blame in ?ow is as we fynde to lete cryst contenue þus day be day With his fals wichcraft þe pepyl to blynde He werkyth fals meraclis Ageyns all kende And makyth oure pepyl to leve hem in It is ?our part to take hym and do hym bynde And gyf hym jugement for his gret syn. ijus doctor For-sothe sere of trewth this is þe case On to our lawe ?e don oppressyon Þat ?e let cryst from ?ou pace and wyl not don on hym correxion Let Annas knowe ?our intencion With prestys and jewgys of þe lawe And do cryst fforsake his fals oppynyon Or in to A preson lete hem be thrawe. Cayphas Wel serys ?e sal se with-inne short whyle I xal correcte hym for his trespas He xal no lenger oure pepyl be-gyle Out of myn dawngere he xal not pas. here comyth þe masangere to cayphas and in þe mene tyme rewfyn and lyon schewyn hem in þe place in ray tabardys furryd and rayhodys a-bouth here neckys furryd þe masangere seyng. Masangere Myn reverent souereyn and it do ?ow plese Sere annas my lord hath to ?ou sent He prayt ?ou þat ?e xal not sese Tyl þat ?e ben with hym present. Cayphas Sere telle myn cosyn I xal not fayl it was my purpose hym for to se For serteyn materys þat wyl provayle Þow he had notwth a sent to me. Masager I recomende me to ?our hey degre on more massagys I must wende. Cayphas Ffare wel sere and wel ?e be gret wel my cosyn and my ffrede here þe masager metyth with þe jewgys sayng Masager Heyl jewgys of jewry of reson most prudent of my massage to ?ou I make relacion my lord sere Annas hath for ?ou sent to se his presens with-owth delacion. Rewfyn Sere we Are redy At his comawndement To se sere Annas in his place it was oure purpose and oure intent to A be with hym with-inne short space. leyon We are ful glad his presence to se sere telle hym we xal come in hast no declaracion þer-in xal be but to his presens hye us fast. masager I xal telle my lord seris as ?e say ?e wyl ful-fylle al his plesawns. Rewfyn Sere telle hym we xal make no delay but come in hast at his instawns. here þe masangere comyth to Annas þus seyng masan[ger] My lord and it plese ?ou to haue intellygens Ser Cayphas comyth to ?ou in hast Rewfyn and lyon wyl se ?our presens And se ?ow here or þis day be past. Annas Sere I kan þe thank of þi dyligens Now ageyn my cosyn I wole walk Serys folwyth me on to his presens Ffor of these materys we must talk. here Annas goth down to mete with cayphas and in þe mene tyme þus seyng Cayphas Now on to annas let us wende ech of vs to knowe otherys intent Many materys I haue in mende Þe wich to hym I xal present. ius doctor C. Sere of all othere thyng remembre þis case Loke þat ihesus be put to schame. ijus doctor C. Whan we come present beforn annas Whe xal rehers all his gret blame. here þe buschopys with here clerkys and þe Pharaseus mett and þe myd place and þer xal be a lytil oratory with stolys and cusshonys clenly be-seyn lych as it were a cownsel hous Annas þus seyng Annas Wel come ser Cayphas and ?e jewgys alle now xal ?e knowe all myn entent A wondyr case serys here is be-falle On wich we must gyf jewgement Lyst þat we aftyre þe case repent Of on cryst þat goddys sone som doth hym calle He shewyth meraclys and sythe present þat he is prynce of pryncys alle. The pepyl so fast to hym doth falle Be prevy menys as we a-spye ?yf he procede son sen ?e xalle þat oure lawys he wyl dystrye. It is oure part þus to deny What is ?our cowncell in þis cas. Cayphas Be reson þe trewth here may we try I cannot dem hym with-outh trespace Be-cause he seyth in every A place þat he kyng of jewys in every degre þerfore he is fals knowe wel þe case Sesar is kyng and non but he. Rewfyn He is An eretyk and a tretour bolde To sesare and to oure lawe sertayn Bothe in word and in werke and ?e be-holde He is worthy to dey with mekyl peyn. leon þe cawse þat we been here present To fortefye þe lawe and trewth to say Jhesus ful nere oure lawys hath shent þerfore he is worthy for to day. ius doctor An[nas] Serys ?e þat ben rewelerys of þe lawe On jhesu ?e must gyf jugement Let hym fyrst ben hangyn and drawe and þanne his body in fyre be brent. ijus doctor An[nas] Now xal ?e here þe intent of me Take jhesu þat werke us all gret schame Put hym to deth let hym not fle For þan þe comownys þei wyl ?ow blame. ius doctor Cayp[has] He werke with weche-crafte in eche place And drawyth þe pepyl to hese intent Be whare ?e jewgys let hym not passe þan be my trewthe ?e xal repent. ijus doctor Cayphas Serys takyth hede on to þis case and in ?our jewgement be not slawe þer was nevyr man dyd so gret trespace As jhesu hath don Ageyn oure lawe. Annas Now bretheryn þan wyl ?e here myn intent These ix days let us A-byde We may not gyf so hasty jugement but eche man inqwere on his syde Send spyes A-bouth þe countre wyde to se and recorde and testymonye And þan hese werkys he xal not hyde nor haue no power hem to denye. Cayphas This cowncell A-cordyth to my reson. Annas And we All to þe same.
